entry.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the act of going into something
entry.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Harry made his entry into the village.
There was no sign of a forced entry.
How did the thieves gain entry (=get in)?
It was dark and their entry into the camp had gone unnoticed.
entry.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: when someone starts to take part in a system, a particular kind of work etc, or the permission they need in order to do this
entry.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: the minimum height for entry into the police force
This enabled European banks to gain entry into new markets.
the entry requirements for a degree course
Britain’s entry into the European Union
entry.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: the right to enter a place, building etc
entry.translation[0].definitions[2].note: no entry (=written on signs to show that you are not allowed to go somewhere)
entry.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The refugees were repeatedly refused entry into  (=not allowed in) the country.
Entry to the gardens is included in the price of admission.
entry.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: something that you write, make, do etc in order to try and win a competition
entry.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The winning entry will be published in our April issue.
What’s the closing date for entries?
entry.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: the number of people or things taking part in a competition
entry.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: We’ve attracted a record entry this year.
entry.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a piece of writing in a diary, or in a book containing information such as a dictionary
entry.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: the act of putting information into a computer
entry.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: a door, gate, or passage that you go through to enter a place
entry.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: the act of going into something
entry.translation[0].note_box[0].section: Burglars use various methods to gain entry to houses.
The church was locked, but he managed to force an entry.
She waited until everyone was sitting down before she made her entry.
The two men were later arrested and charged with illegal entry.
There was a big sign on the door saying NO UNAUTHORIZED ENTRY.
There were no signs of a forced entry, but several paintings were missing.
The 2,000 mile border is the main entry point into the country for illegal aliens.
entry.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: when someone starts to take part in a system, a particular kind of work etc, or the permission they need in order to do this
entry.translation[0].note_box[1].section: You need good exam results to gain entry to the best universities.
Tariffs on trade have the effect of restricting entry into the market.
Japan has one of the highest rates of college and university entry in the world.
Applicants must satisfy the normal entry requirements for the school.
What are the entry qualifications for the course?
entry.translation[0].note_box[2].heading: – Meaning 3: the right to enter a place, building etc
entry.translation[0].note_box[2].section: Guests have free entry to the hotel spa and gym.
Visitors to the United States must first obtain an entry visa.
The holiday includes a 2-day entry ticket to the Euro Disneyland Theme Park.
The number of people applying for entry into the country is increasing every year.
Citizens of most EU countries are allowed automatic entry into Britain.
He was refused entry to the club because he was wearing trainers.
The door had ‘No Entry’ written in large letters.
entry.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the arrival of people or goods in a country
entry.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: border patrol officers who control illegal entry into the US
entry.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: when a company starts selling goods or services in a market where they have not sold them before
entry.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: In South Korea, smoking rates among teenage boys nearly doubled after the entry of US brands.
Technological changes have helped reduce the costs of market entry, especially in telecommunications.
entry.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a figure or other piece of information entered in a set of accounts
entry.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: In a double-entry system of bookkeeping, each debit has a corresponding credit entry.
entry.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: when you put information into a computer
entry.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: Press Esc to return to menu at any time duringdata entry.
